item.title: Carnot Overview
item.description: Carnot (formerly LogosBFT) is a Byzantine Fault Tolerant (BFT) consensus candidate for the Nomos Network that utilizes Fountain Codes and a committees tree structure to optimize message propagation in the presence of a large number of nodes, while maintaining high througput and fast finality.

item.title: Claro: Consensus Candidate
item.description: Claro (formerly Glacier) is a consensus candidate for the Logos network that aims to be an improvement to the Avalanche family of consensus protocols.
